description: Any non-linear shaped opening enclosed by ice. May contain brash ice and/or be covered with new ice, nilas or young ice; sub-mariners refer to these as skylights. Polynyas are important in the study of the energy budget of the polar ocean and local and regional climatology. [Canadian Ice Service - Environment Canada: http://www.cis.ec.gc.ca/manice/chp1_eng.htm . See also Hall, D.K. and J. Martinec. 1985. Remote Sensing of Ice and Snow, Chapman and Hall. London.]
title: Polynyas
